meanings.sent1: After the party, I will regreet my friends at the door.
meanings.sent2: I regreeted my neighbor when I saw her at the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: He decided to regreet his old teddy bear with a big smile.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun seemed to regreet the sleepy town with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The flowers regreeted the bees with their colorful petals.

meanings.definition: To express regret or sorrow for.
meanings.sent1: She will regreet her mistake and try to make amends.
meanings.sent2: He regreeted his harsh words and apologized sincerely.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to regreet knocking over the vase, looking guilty.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds regreeted the sunny sky, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The child's eyes regreeted the broken toy, filled with sadness.
